title: Power BI Analyst
job_overview:
Are you a Power BI pro who loves turning messy data into clear insights?
Do you get excited about building dashboards that actually drive decisions—and fixing the ones that don’t? If that sounds like you, keep reading.

We’re a fast-growing, private equity-backed manufacturer looking for a Power BI Analyst who’s ready to dive in, get their hands dirty with real business data, and create high-impact reporting across departments. You’ll be working closely with our Director of FP&A and BI, and you’ll have the opportunity to shape how data flows through the business—right from SQL to the executive dashboard.

This isn’t a “maintain what’s already built” role. We need someone who thrives in an evolving environment and enjoys building, optimizing, and improving dashboards that support Sales, Engineering, Quality, Production, HR, and more.

What You’ll Own:
Design and build high-performance dashboards that serve real business needs across departments.
Improve performance of ~25 existing dashboards—fix refresh issues, speed up load times, and optimize queries.
Write and troubleshoot SQL queries, mostly from a custom ERP (Infor Sightline or similar).
Integrate additional data sources—Excel, SharePoint, Salesforce, and more—into your reports.
Handle ad hoc reporting and extend dashboards with fresh visuals or new functionality.
Work directly with stakeholders to translate business questions into actionable data.
(Optional but valuable) Support data storytelling by summarizing trends into clear narratives.

Who You Are:
Experienced with Power BI—you’re confident in DAX, data modeling, and creating clean, intuitive dashboards.
Strong in SQL—you can join tables, build views, and debug queries without blinking.
You’ve worked with ERP data before and know how to navigate the quirks (Infor Sightline experience is a bonus).
You’re comfortable pulling data from different platforms—SharePoint, Excel, Salesforce—and blending it all together.
You’re a great communicator who can listen to business needs and turn them into simple, visual reports.
You’re self-driven, used to wearing multiple hats, and not afraid to take ownership of a full BI workflow.
Bonus points if you’ve worked in manufacturing, private equity, or cross-functional environments.

Company Benefits:
$500 USD Sign-In Bonus if you apply between July 10 to September 25, 2025
Competitive compensation package
Opportunity to work closely with high-level executives from various industries.
Professional growth and development.
Chance to contribute to the success and growth of our clients.
Supportive and collaborative team environment.
Paid US Federal Holidays
Paid Time Off
Healthcare Package
1 Year Travel Bonus
Year-End Bonus

How to Apply:
1. Complete the Form: Start by filling out the form at wkf.ms/3AnjFVK.
2. Video Recording: Ensure you have a professional background when recording your video.
3. Be Authentic: We strongly discourage reading from a script. Instead, be genuine and let your personality shine!
4. Email Confirmation: Make sure to provide a valid email address to receive our application confirmation. If you don’t see the confirmation email, double-check for any spelling errors and resubmit the form with the correct email.
5. Next Steps: If your qualifications meet our criteria, our Recruitment Specialist will reach out to you.
